fiction.title: Les Mis√©rables
fiction.author: Victor Hugo
fiction.description: Thanks to this novel, I am convinced that even a single act of mercy can transform a human being into a force for good.

fiction.title: The Mysterious Island
fiction.author: Jules Verne
fiction.description: Five stranded prisoners must survive on a mysterious island. This is the dearest book of my childhood, showing the triumph of science and creativity.

fiction.title: The Brothers Karamazov
fiction.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
fiction.description: A philosophical murder mystery that looks into the tough questions that we learned to avoid so well in our busy daily lives.

fiction.title: Siddhartha
fiction.author: Hermann Hesse
fiction.description: A journey of self-discovery as a young Brahmin seeks enlightenment. The novel offers a Western perspective on Eastern wisdom and the path to inner peace.

fiction.title: The Foundation Pit
fiction.author: Andrei Platonov
fiction.description: A Soviet-era allegory about workers digging a foundation for a utopian building that never materializes. I absolutely adore how Platonov captures the absurdity of forced collectivism.

fiction.title: The Old Man and the Sea
fiction.author: Ernest Hemingway
fiction.description: A powerful tale about dignity that reminds me that a human can lose but can't be defeated.

fiction.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
fiction.author: Harper Lee
fiction.description: A profound exploration of moral courage that showed me what it means and takes to do right.

fiction.title: Cancer Ward
fiction.author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn
fiction.description: Set in a Soviet hospital, patients from all walks of life confront disease and mortality. Solzhenitsyn transforms a cancer ward into a microcosm where everyone is forced to reflect on their life choices.

fiction.title: The Doomed City
fiction.author: Arkady and Boris Strugatsky
fiction.description: In a surreal city people from different eras and nations participate in a mysterious Experiment. This is a darkly philosophical tale about human nature and impact of ideology.

fiction.title: The Three-Body Problem Trilogy
fiction.author: Liu Cixin
fiction.description: This is a hard science fiction novel set on a truly cosmic scale, beginning during China's Cultural Revolution and spanning for centuries. I sometimes find it hard to believe that such imagination could originate from a human mind.
